title: Is U.S. National Debt Getting Out Of Hand?
text: As debate over further economic stimulus drags on, one theme for reigning in stimulus spending is the high level of government debt. Does it matter?

title: A Classic Bubble
text: Early in 2018, Jeremy Grantham laid out a path for a classic bubble in the S&P 500 Index.

title: U.S. stock futures flat ahead of another big earnings week
text: U.S. stock index futures were little changed late Sunday, as Wall Street awaits another busy earnings week while negotiations for another pandemic-relief bill continue on Capitol Hill.

title: Dollar on defensive as U.S. recovery story in doubt
text: The U.S. dollar ticked up in early Monday trade, clinging to its rebound late last week, but mounting concerns about a slowing U.S. economic recovery from coronavirus epidemic kept a lid on gains.

title: U.S. Stock Market Update: Summer Road Trip Twists and Turns
text: Last week, I sat down with Max Wiethe from Real Vision to discuss a myriad of timely and relevant market topics for investors. You can watch this video via the link at the end of the article.

title: Oil edges lower on oversupply concerns as OPEC+ set to raise output
text: Oil prices fell on Monday on concerns about oversupply as OPEC and its allies, together known as OPEC+, are due to pull back from production cuts in August while an increase in COVID-19 cases worldwide raised fears of slower pick-up in fuel demand.

title: U.S. stock futures rise as earnings season, stimulus talks continue
text: Futures rose at the start of the overnight session Sunday evening as investors turned their attention back to Washington.

title: What Effect Will Lockdowns Plus New Stimulus Checks Have On Markets This Week
text: Wall Street begging for stimulus checks. Gold is golden.

title: Fed's Kashkari suggests 4-6 week shutdown; says U.S. Congress can spend big on coronavirus relief
text: The U.S. economy could benefit if the nation were to "lock down really hard" for four to six weeks, a top Federal Reserve official said on Sunday, adding that Congress can well afford large sums for coronavirus relief efforts.

title: August Begins With Positive Weekly Charts For 5 Major Equity Averages. Here’s What’s Key To The Upside This Week.
text: All five major equity averages are above their five-week modified moving averages with rising or overbought 12-week stochastic readings. Here's what to look for this week.

title: Stock Market: Goodbye Passive Indexing, Hello Active Stock Picking
text: The active-passive-active cycle is shifting to active, with large outperformance potential

title: Relief Package Deal Remains Elusive as Impasse Over Jobless Benefits Persists
text: Negotiators acknowledged some progress over the weekend, but said they remained far apart on a number of issues.

title: Buy Bonds Now
text: Bonds are due to rally in August.

title: Stimulus talks: White House, Dems still agree on $1,200 checks but deadlocked on unemployment assistance
text: Familiar fault lines continue to separate the White House and congressional Democrats on the next coronavirus stimulus package a day after an extended meeting between House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and administration officials.

title: U.S. companies leap over low profit hurdle in coronavirus-hit quarter
text: A record high percentage of U.S. companies are beating analysts' forecasts this earnings season, giving investors a glimmer of hope in what is still expected to be the slowest profit period since the financial crisis.

title: 'Be Wary Of Cashing In': Stock Market Update For The Week Ahead
text: What Happened: Stocks closed the week practically unchanged after mixed reactions to a slew of blow-out earnings results.

title: Why looking at the stock market won’t give you full picture of US economy
text: Between the federal government and the Federal Reserve, about $10 trillion has been pumped into the US economy to prevent a pandemic-fueled economic collapse. Judging by the stock market, you would think we’ve sidestepped a 2008-size disaster.

title: July 2020 Yield Curve Update
text: The Fed is failing us. It started out great. The initial reaction to the pandemic was timely and forceful. The yield curve on March 18 was signaling confidence.

title: Here are five charts illustrating U.S. economic trends amid the coronavirus pandemic (Aug 02)
text: These five charts illustrate trends in important industries that help track reopening progress in the U.S. amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: It’s Hurricane Season For S&P 500 Investors.  How To Prepare.
text: During much of 2019, I repeated the analogy of the S&P 500’s path to that of a hurricane.

title: Stimulus talks have stalled. But the pressure to act is rising
text: A resilient US job market in May and June fed investor hopes that a strong economic recovery could quickly power the country out of a crippling recession. But the jobs report for July, due this week, may serve as a reality check — raising pressure on Congress to push through another round of stimulus spending.

title: Q2 2020 Equity Manager Report: Tech In The Driver's Seat
text: Is the tech-fueled rebound in equity markets beginning to expand to other sectors?

title: Avoiding A Second Wave
text: About two-thirds of this month's comment is about COVID-19 and the risk of a second wave.

title: Weighing The Week Ahead: Is The Payroll Employment Report Accurate?
text: It is a big week for data, with a focus on employment.

title: Navigating The Pandemic And Beyond
text: We still expect the economy to remain on a recovery path but it will not be as quick as earlier assumed.
